entry.title: Natalie Bergman: ‘Gunslinger’ (KCRW Todays Top Tune)
entry.content:
Natalie Bergman: ‘Gunslinger’

 Best New Music

Soul-siren Natalie Bergman returns with her sophomore LP My Home Is Not In This World (due July 18 via Third Man Records).

May 30

entry.title: Nation of Language: ‘Inept Apollo’ (KCRW Todays Top Tune)
entry.content:
Nation of Language: ‘Inept Apollo’

 Best New Music

Brooklyn-based trio Nation of Language has an ardent-and-ever-expanding international audience for their danceable take on new wave, post-punk, and shoegaze.

May 29

entry.title: Ben Harper: ‘Before The Rain Dried’ (KCRW Todays Top Tune)
entry.content:
Ben Harper: ‘Before The Rain Dried’

 Best New Music

Three-time Grammy-winner Ben Harper has amassed an international audience with his genre-defying work.

May 28

entry.title: Tatyana Richaud: ‘Dandelions’ (KCRW Todays Top Tune)
entry.content:
Tatyana Richaud: ‘Dandelions’

 Best New Music

KCRW Young Creators Project alum, Tatyana Richaud , just hit us with a new experimental pop production — “Dandelions.”

May 27

entry.title: Steve Stout: ‘Some Folks’ (KCRW Todays Top Tune)
entry.content:
Steve Stout: ‘Some Folks’

 Best New Music

Ex-rocker/new-folker Steve Stout recently updated his sound to lean a little less lo-fi, and a little more in line with artists like Fruit Bats and Kurt Vile.

May 26

entry.title: Lamont Landers: ‘Lotta Love’ (KCRW Todays Top Tune)
entry.content:
Lamont Landers: ‘Lotta Love’

 Best New Music

Alabama-based Lamont Landers funnels himself into his songs, infusing each note with raw power and grit.

May 23

entry.title: MRCY: ‘Wandering Attention’ (KCRW Todays Top Tune)
entry.content:
MRCY: ‘Wandering Attention’

 Best New Music

You probably recognize MRCY ’s “Wandering Attention” from our recent world premiere on Morning Becomes Eclectic.

May 22

entry.title: Sharp Pins: ‘Sycophant’ (KCRW Todays Top Tune)
entry.content:
Sharp Pins: ‘Sycophant’

 Best New Music

Chi-town indie artist Kai Slater records their quirky, nostalgic, lo-fi ditties under the moniker Sharp Pins. They also produce a rad ‘zine called HALLOGALLO .

May 21
